datafield.subfield: A New Rock Slicing Algorithm with Reduced Data Structure for Discrete Element Method Analyses for Rock Mechanics

A new rock slicing method to be employed in Discrete Element Method analyses has been introduced by Boon et al. (Comput. Geotech. 65, 12–29 [1]). In this method only a single data structure level is required rather than the 2 or 3 levels currently employed in the literature. This implies that the calculation of intersections between discontinuities and block faces is no longer needed. The algorithms of the method have been implemented in the open source code YADE. Also in this paper, various applications of the method to rock mechanics problems involving jointed rock masses, namely underground excavations and slope stability are showcased.
